ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I improved my listening, reading, writing, and speaking skills in Spanish. Mostly, I learned the technicalities of various grammatical skills and new vocabulary. This grammar included the past, past perfect, past participles, simple future, subjunctive, and more.
I developed very significantly in my Spanish abilities. I became better in reading, writing, and speaking.
confidence in speaking, spanish profficiency, enjoyment
My Spanish really improved in this class and I definitely got better at speaking and presenting in Spanish.  I learned lots of tenses and vocab too.

I developed and learned basic Spanish spelling, vocabulary, reading comprehension, writing, and grammar rules. I learned how to easily develop and articulate a conversation with a lower level of Spanish proficiency. We also learned about different Spanish-speaking countries and did research to find more about them throughout the year. Through each lesson, there was a purpose that was connected to how to use Spanish in our day-to-day life.
I learned more Spanish, up to the point of being able to roughly follow most written Spanish with occasional dictionary help.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course really pushes you and is of high intensity. As a result, you quickly learn concepts, and I really could feel and see my Spanish skills improving. The expectations of this course are a bit too unrealistic.

The strengths are the many different ways this class is taught, there are many different ways for students to learn. The weaknesses are that everyone enters with a different ability, so many times students have to work at different levels of strain.
Good amount of group activity, more listening to Spanish, more targeted feedback on errors,
Overall, I really liked how this course was done and I really liked my professor, Professor Asensio. I think it goes pretty fast but it is manageable.

The strengths of this course are definitely the units that are taught because all the vocabulary and lesson plans are relevant to how we would need to use Spanish in the real world. Another strength would be the amount of speaking, writing and listening is balanced and developed in the course because it trains the student to solely focus their brain on learning the language.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes; if you want to improve your Spanish, you definitely will. So, I highly recommend it because you will learn.
I would because it helps you improve your Spanish and doesn't involve too much work.
I would recommend this course. I enjoyed being in Professor Asensio's class and she was very helpful in improving my Spanish.  The class was fun and we all improved a lot.
Yes, I developed a lot of progress and growth in my Spanish learning.
If you want to learn Spanish you have to take it...
